  • Method Details

    • login

      @PostMapping(value="/login", consumes="multipart/form-data") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map> login(@RequestParam("imageFile") org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile imageFile, @RequestPart("user") String userJson) throws Exception
      POST - User login requests with image verification. This method processes POST requests to the "/login" endpoint, expecting a multipart form-data request that includes an image file and user information in JSON format. It first checks if the uploaded image file is empty and returns a 400 Bad Request response if it is. If the file is valid, it prepares a User object from the provided JSON and retrieves the corresponding stored image from S3 using the user's username. The method then compares the uploaded image with the stored image. If the faces do not match, it returns a 403 Forbidden response. If the faces match, it authenticates the user and retrieves their role (either Teacher or Student). Finally, it returns a response containing an authentication token and the user's role.

      Return values:

      • 200 OK with a map containing the authentication token and user role if login is successful.
      • 400 Bad Request if the image file is empty.
      • 403 Forbidden if the faces do not match.
      Parameters:
      imageFile - The image file uploaded as part of the request, representing the user's face for verification.
      userJson - A JSON string containing user information, which is converted to a User object for authentication purposes. Example JSON format: 
                       {
                     "username": "john_doe",
                     "password": "securePassword123"
                 }
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a map with the authentication token and user role, or appropriate error responses based on validation checks.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs during user object creation, image retrieval, face comparison, or authentication.

      Example response for successful login:

       {
     "token": "abc123xyz",
     "role": "Teacher"
 }

    • register

      @PostMapping(value="/register", consumes="multipart/form-data") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> register(@RequestParam("imageFile") org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile imageFile, @RequestPart("user") String userJson) throws Exception
      POST - Registers a new user with an uploaded image. Username with ':' is not allowed to avoid conflicts in Redis or S3. This method processes POST requests to the "/register" endpoint, expecting a multipart form-data request that includes an image file and user details in JSON format. It checks if the uploaded image file is present and validates the username before proceeding with the registration process.
      Parameters:
      imageFile - the image file uploaded by the user (required)
      userJson - the user details in JSON format (required). Example JSON format: 
                        {
                      "username": "john_doe",
                      "password": "securePassword123",
                  }
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with the registration status and message.
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an error processing the registration.

      Expected Status Codes:

      • 201 Created: User registered successfully.
      • 400 Bad Request: If the image file is missing.
      • 409 Conflict: If the username already exists.

    • handleRegister

      @Transactional protected boolean handleRegister(User user)
